metadata.description: The ID of the Service Principal created for Trend Micro's App Registration.

The region of the Trend Micro Cloud One services.
For more information, see supported Cloud One regions.
The principal ID of the managed identity assigned to the Scanner Function.
The Scanner Queue's namespace name.

The resource ID of Storage Account to scan. The ID can be found in the Storage Account's Endpoints page.
For example, /subscriptions/1234abcd-3c6d-4347-9019-123456789012/resourceGroups/storage-resource-group/providers/Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/protectingstorageaccount
Select Yes if the system topic of the protecting storage account is already created. Select No, to deploy a new system topic.
The name of the existing Event Grid System Topic associated to the Blob Storage Account or the Event Grid System Topic to be created and associated.

Post scan action function requires Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers/blobs/write permission to update blob metadata. Select Yes to update the blob metadata and index tag with the scan result. Select No to update only the blob index tag.

Select Yes to report the object keys of the scanned objects to File Storage Security backend services. File Storage Security can then display the object keys of the malicious objects in the response of events API.
Warning: Do not modify the field. Modifications may cause your deployment to fail.
Warning: Do not modify the field. Modifications may cause your deployment to fail.
Warning: Do not modify the field. Modifications may cause your deployment to fail.

This field requires the resource ID of the existing Log Analytics workspace that the deployed Application Insights resources is associated with. If you don't want to manage the Log Analytics workspace by yourself, please leave this field blank.

[VNet Only]
This field requires the resource ID of the existing virtual network (VNet) that the deployed resource will be associated with. If you wish to deploy the resource into a VNet, please see Deploy in VNet for detailed instructions and ensure that the required resources have been created.
If a VNet is not required, please leave this field blank.

[VNet Only]
The name of the subnet used by the BlobListener Function App.

[VNet Only]
The name of the subnet used by the Post Scan Action Tag Function App.

[VNet Only]
Provide the name of the subnet used to create private endpoints for other resources such as Service Bus and Storage Account.

[VNet Only]
To connect to stack resources via private endpoints, use the Private DNS zone resource ID for the storage account file.
For example:
/subscriptions/1234abcd-3c6d-4347-9019-123456789012/resourceGroups/resource-group-name/providers/Microsoft.Network/privateDnsZones/privatelink.file.core.windows.net
Please confirm the Private DNS zone name is correct and refer to Azure Private Endpoint DNS configuration.
If a VNet is not required, please leave this field blank.

[VNet Only]
To connect to stack resources via private endpoints, use the Private DNS zone resource ID for the storage account blob.
For example:
/subscriptions/1234abcd-3c6d-4347-9019-123456789012/resourceGroups/resource-group-name/providers/Microsoft.Network/privateDnsZones/privatelink.blob.core.windows.net
Please confirm the Private DNS zone name is correct and refer to Azure Private Endpoint DNS configuration.
If a VNet is not required, please leave this field blank.

[VNet Only]
To connect to stack resources via private endpoints, use the Private DNS zone resource ID for the service bus.
For example:
/subscriptions/1234abcd-3c6d-4347-9019-123456789012/resourceGroups/resource-group-name/providers/Microsoft.Network/privateDnsZones/privatelink.servicebus.windows.net
Please confirm the Private DNS zone name is correct and refer to Azure Private Endpoint DNS configuration.
If a VNet is not required, please leave this field blank.

[VNet Only]
Indicates if public access to Azure Monitor resources is restricted, for example, Application Insights or Log Analytics workspace. If set to true, Azure Monitor resources can only be accessed through the Azure Monitor Private Link Scope. If you don't add the Application Insights and Log Analytics workspace to the Azure Monitor Private Link Scope, you won't be able to ingest or query data. For more information on how to configure Private Link for Application Insights and Log Analytics workspace, see Restrict access to Application Insights and Log Analytics workspace'. If VNet is not required, choose false.

[To Be Deprecated][VNet Only]
The parameter will be replaced by VNETRestrictedAccessForAzureMonitorResources after 2024/10/31. Before it's fully deprecated, configuring either one to true means to restrict public network access to Application Insights and Azure Monitor resources.
Indicates whether to restrict public access to Application Insights. If set to true, Application Insights can only be accessed through Azure Monitor Private Link Scope. If you don't add the Application Insight to the Azure Monitor Private Link Scope, you won't be able to ingest or query data. For more information on how to configure Private Link for Application Insights, see Restrict access to Application Insights'. If VNet is not required, choose false.

Warning: this field is only used when creating a resource group. Changing it when updating will cause your deployment to fail.
The function app's service plan for Azure functions is in the storage stack. Choose 'EP1' to use the premium hosting plan to boost performance. This setting only takes effect when the deployment is not integrated with the VNet solution.

properties.description: The Role has Blob Writer permission
The Role has Blob read and generate delegation key permission
